citation.article-title: Constrictibacter antarcticus gen. nov., sp. nov., a cryptoendolithic micro-organism from Antarctic white rock
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Constrictibacter (Cons.tric.ti.bac′ter. L. adj. constrictus compressed, contracted; N.L. masc. n. bacter a rod; N.L. masc. n. Constrictibacter rod with compressed parts).
A member of the class Alphaproteobacteria, order Rhodospirillales, family Rhodospirillaceae.
Cells are ovoid to rod-shaped and often occur in pairs or chains.
Cells are motile and do not form spores.
The respiratory quinones are Q-10 and Q-8.
The major cellular fatty acids are C18 : 1, C16 : 0 and C18 : 0.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain of the type species is 69.8 mol%.
The type species is Constrictibacter antarcticus.
